definitions: To remove an item of clothing or an accessory from one's body.
To deduct an amount from a total price or sum.
To remove something from a surface or a position.
To take a period of time as a break from work or other duties.
To imitate someone or something, often humorously.
examples: Please take your shoes off at the door.
The store took $20 off the price of the jacket.
She took the pot off the stove.
I'm going to take a few days off next week.
He can really take off his boss.
